LABA.name: Long-Acting Beta-2 Agonists
LABA.mechanism: Bronchodilation via beta-2 receptor stimulation, relaxes smooth muscle

medications.name: Salmeterol
medications.special_notes: Most studied standalone LABA, slow onset limits use as rescue

medications.name: Formoterol
medications.special_notes: Rapid onset, available in nebulized form

medications.name: Arformoterol
medications.special_notes: R-enantiomer of formoterol, nebulized only

medications.name: Indacaterol
medications.special_notes: Once-daily dosing, withdrawn from US/Canada market but available elsewhere

medications.name: Olodaterol
medications.special_notes: Soft mist delivery, helpful for poor inspiratory flow

medications.name: Vilanterol
medications.special_notes: Available only in combination with umeclidinium or fluticasone

LAMA.name: Long-Acting Muscarinic Antagonists
LAMA.mechanism: Bronchodilation via cholinergic blockade, reduces vagal tone

medications.name: Tiotropium
medications.dose: 18 mcg (DPI) or 2.5 mcg per actuation, 2 inhalations (SMI)
medications.special_notes: Most extensively studied LAMA, reduces hyperinflation, excreted renally

medications.name: Aclidinium
medications.special_notes: Very low bioavailability (<5%), may reduce systemic side effects

medications.name: Umeclidinium
medications.special_notes: Once-daily dosing, sustained bronchodilation

medications.name: Glycopyrrolate (Glycopyrronium)
medications.frequency: Once or twice daily depending on formulation
medications.special_notes: Similar efficacy to tiotropium, excreted renally

medications.name: Revefenacin
medications.special_notes: Nebulized LAMA, reserved for patients unable to use inhalers, avoid in hepatic impairment

LAMA_LABA_combinations.name: LAMA-LABA Fixed-Dose Combinations
LAMA_LABA_combinations.rationale: Improved adherence, complementary mechanisms, reduced pill burden

medications.name: Tiotropium-Olodaterol
medications.components: Tiotropium 2.5 mcg + Olodaterol 2.5 mcg per actuation
medications.special_notes: Soft mist delivery system

medications.name: Umeclidinium-Vilanterol
medications.special_notes: Simple once-daily dosing

medications.name: Glycopyrronium-Indacaterol
medications.special_notes: Available in some regions, not currently marketed in US

medications.name: Glycopyrrolate-Formoterol
medications.components: Glycopyrrolate 9 mcg + Formoterol 4.8 mcg per actuation
medications.special_notes: MDI formulation, twice-daily dosing

medications.name: Aclidinium-Formoterol
medications.special_notes: Twice-daily dosing

LABA_ICS_combinations.name: LABA-ICS Fixed-Dose Combinations
LABA_ICS_combinations.indication: Alternative for Group E patients who cannot use LAMA

medications.name: Salmeterol-Fluticasone
medications.special_notes: Most studied LABA-ICS combination

medications.name: Formoterol-Budesonide
medications.special_notes: Rapid-onset LABA component

medications.name: Vilanterol-Fluticasone furoate
medications.components: Vilanterol 25 mcg + Fluticasone furoate 100 or 200 mcg
medications.special_notes: Once-daily dosing

medications.name: Formoterol-Mometasone
medications.special_notes: Available for COPD in some regions

triple_therapy.name: LAMA-LABA-ICS Triple Therapy
triple_therapy.indication: Group E with high eosinophils (≥300 cells/μL) or frequent exacerbations

medications.name: Umeclidinium-Vilanterol-Fluticasone furoate
medications.components: Umeclidinium 62.5 mcg + Vilanterol 25 mcg + Fluticasone furoate 100 mcg
medications.special_notes: Single-inhaler triple therapy, once-daily

medications.name: Glycopyrronium-Formoterol-Beclometasone
medications.components: Glycopyrronium 10 mcg + Formoterol 5 mcg + Beclometasone 87 mcg
medications.special_notes: Extrafine particle formulation

medications.name: Albuterol (Salbutamol)
medications.frequency: 2 puffs as needed, up to every 4-6 hours
medications.device: MDI or nebulizer solution (2.5 mg/3 mL)
medications.special_notes: Most commonly used rescue bronchodilator

medications.name: Levalbuterol
medications.frequency: 2 puffs as needed, up to every 4-6 hours
medications.special_notes: R-enantiomer of albuterol, may have fewer cardiovascular effects

SAMA.name: Short-Acting Muscarinic Antagonists
SAMA.indication: Rescue therapy (combination with SABA for patients not on LAMA)

medications.name: Ipratropium
medications.device: MDI or nebulizer solution (0.5 mg/2.5 mL)
medications.special_notes: Not recommended with LAMA therapy due to cumulative anticholinergic effects

SABA_SAMA_combinations.name: SABA-SAMA Combinations
SABA_SAMA_combinations.indication: Rescue therapy for patients not on LAMA

medications.name: Ipratropium-Albuterol
medications.components: Ipratropium 20 mcg + Albuterol 100 mcg per actuation
medications.device: SMI or nebulizer solution (0.5 mg ipratropium + 2.5 mg albuterol/3 mL)
medications.special_notes: Synergistic bronchodilation, preferred rescue for patients not on LAMA

MDI.name: Metered Dose Inhaler
technique_key_points: Press canister while inhaling slowly and deeply

SMI.name: Soft Mist Inhaler
technique_key_points: Press release button while inhaling slowly

Nebulizer.name: Nebulizer
technique_key_points: Breathe normally through mouthpiece or mask

LABA_side_effects.tremor: Reduce dose or switch to LAMA
LABA_side_effects.tachycardia: Monitor heart rate, consider dose reduction or LAMA alternative
LABA_side_effects.palpitations: ECG if persistent, consider switching to LAMA
LABA_side_effects.hypokalemia: Monitor potassium, especially with high doses or diuretic use

LAMA_side_effects.dry_mouth: Most common, rinse mouth after use, sips of water, sugar-free candy
LAMA_side_effects.urinary_retention: Monitor in patients with BPH, consider LABA alternative
LAMA_side_effects.constipation: Increase fiber and fluids, consider stool softener
LAMA_side_effects.blurred_vision: Ensure mist not directed toward eyes, consider alternative if persistent

ICS_side_effects.oral_candidiasis: Rinse mouth and spit after each use, treat with antifungal if occurs
ICS_side_effects.dysphonia: Rinse mouth after use, voice rest, reduce dose if severe
ICS_side_effects.pneumonia_risk: Increased risk especially with high doses; use lowest effective dose
ICS_side_effects.bruising: Common with long-term use, generally not serious
ICS_side_effects.osteoporosis: Bone density screening, calcium/vitamin D supplementation

LABA: Beta-blockers: may reduce effectiveness or cause bronchospasm
MAO inhibitors, tricyclic antidepressants: may potentiate cardiovascular effects
QT-prolonging drugs: additive effect on QT interval
LAMA: Drugs that cause urinary retention: increased risk
ICS: Strong CYP3A4 inhibitors (ritonavir, ketoconazole): increased systemic exposure
Live vaccines: theoretical risk with high-dose ICS

renal_impairment.LAMA: Tiotropium and glycopyrrolate excreted renally - monitor for anticholinergic effects; aclidinium safer (low bioavailability)
renal_impairment.LABA: Generally safe, no dose adjustment needed

hepatic_impairment.other_medications: Generally safe with dose adjustments as needed

cardiovascular_disease.monitoring: Monitor for arrhythmias, tachycardia with LABA use
cardiovascular_disease.safety: Both LABA and LAMA generally safe; individualize therapy

narrow_angle_glaucoma.LAMA: Use with caution, ensure mist not directed toward eyes

BPH.LAMA: Increased urinary retention risk; monitor closely or use LABA
BPH.aclidinium: May be safer due to low bioavailability
